poem:
### The Essentials

Not the purple,  
but the crisp lines—  
the clean air,  
and morning light  
through an open window—  
plain cotton,  
whispering secrets  
of what endures:  
the heart of  
a man, undressed  
by trends,  
finding himself  
in the echo  
of everyday things.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "‘Most men don’t need a purple suit’: why you should go back to basics to find your signature style When people find out I work in fashion, they usually do one of two things: ask me to evaluate their look – awkward – or ask me, “What’s trending this season?” The second is actually the harder. That’s because, when it comes to menswear, being a la mode is less about some kind of seismic change". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
